intro: Eurychorda, commonly known as the sea holly, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Asteraceae. It is characterized by its distinctive, spiny leaves and showy, blue or purple flower heads that resemble small holly berries. Native to coastal regions of southern Europe and North Africa, it thrives in saline and sandy soils. The plant is often found growing along shores and in dunes, where it plays a role in stabilizing sand dunes. Its unique morphology and ecological adaptation make it an important species in coastal ecosystems.
